title: 39 Ways to Save the Planet: #7 More Power from the Sun

sources.author: Science (American Association for the Advancement of Science)

cards.term: Briefly describe the new cells discussed in the programme.
cards.definition: Tandem solar cells that pair silicon with a metal halide perovskite are a promising option for surpassing the single-cell efficiency limit. Science reports a monolithic perovskite/silicon tandem with a certified power conversion efficiency of 29.15%.

multiplechoice.text: What type of energy do photons impart to electrons when they strike them?
Silicon is best at converting which part of the colour spectrum into energy?
A good quality conventional solar panel has a potential output of ~320 watts; what is the potential of a perovskite-silicon panel?
A 2-junction, or perovskite-silicon tandem, cell captures approximately what percent of sunlight?

unranked.text: Conventional solar panels capture approximately what percent of the sun's energy?
Which material does Oxford PV use to convert the blue part of the spectrum into energy?
Oxford PV has demonstrated what level (percent) of efficiency in their perovskite-silicon cells?
Henry at Oxford PV places what ceiling on photovoltaic efficiency (as a percent)?

multipleselect.text: If standard photovoltaic cells replaced fossil fuels, Dr Edwards makes what forecasts? This would __ by 2050
answers: be accompanied by a 20% conversion of energy from sunlight
lead to a 12% reduction in emissions
alternatives: lead to a 2% reduction in emissions
be accompanied by a 10% conversion of energy from sunlight

multipleselect.text: If the most efficient perovskite-silicon cells replaced fossil fuels, Dr Edwards makes what forecasts? This would __ by 2050
answers: be accompanied by a 45% conversion of energy from sunlight
lead to a 27% reduction in emissions
alternatives: lead to an 18% reduction in emissions
be accompanied by a 30% conversion of energy from sunlight
